We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.*

title: Web & Brand Designer
description:
Are you a sharp, fast-moving designer who wants to use your creative skills as a force for good? Here’s your chance!


As Norrsken Foundation’s **Web & Brand Designer**, your mission is to craft high-impact design work, helping tell the stories of the world's greatest challenges through the brilliant people who are trying to solve them.


You’ll work across the entire Norrsken ecosystem, including our Houses in Stockholm, Kigali, Barcelona, Brussels, our funds and global initiatives like Impact/100, Impact/Week and Africa/Week.


You’ll be part of a small and agile marketing team, working closely with our Creative Director, Motion Designer and Digital Marketing Manager to push the boundaries of what great brand design can look like in the impact/tech/startup space. This is a hands-on role for a multi-skilled creative who thrives on variety and ownership. From designing and maintaining our websites, to producing campaign assets, social content, and printed materials. You’ll play a central role in how we express the Norrsken brand across platforms, markets, and initiatives.

### **Role responsibilities**

* **Design and own all things web**  

Design, build and iterate on our branded websites (experience in Webflow is a plus), ensuring strong UX, design and high performance. From page design and site architecture to conversion flows and analytics, including setting up and optimizing Google Analytics
  
* **Produce digital assets across various formats and platforms**  

Produce content and templates for Social Media Instagram stories, editing images, presentations. You’ll produce and ensure high quality output for multiple stakeholders in the Norrsken ecosystem.
  
* **Design for print & physical space**  

Support with campaign rollouts, signage, event graphics and other IRL expressions of the brand.
  
* **Develop and maintain design systems & templates**  

Ensure our brand guidelines, templates and creative processes are scalable, easy to use and adapted by stakeholders.
  
* **Work cross-functionally and globally**  

Collaborate with our Creative Director, Motion Designer, and Digital Marketing Manager as various stakeholders throughout our funds and houses to create seamless brand experiences across channels.

### **To thrive and succeed, we believe you bring**

* 3+ years of experience as a digital or brand designer in an agency, startup or in-house environment.
* Strong skills in building and developing websites, ideally in Webflow, with the ability to manage projects independently from concept to launch. A basic understanding of HTML and JavaScript.
* Comfortable in a wide variety of design disciplines using Figma / Sketch and Adobe Creative Suite.
* Have an eye for photography, image editing and layout, bonus if you’ve worked with photography.
* You have an eye for details, always looking for smarter ways to do things, and thrive in a team that builds fast and figures it out on the way.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
* 

#### **Working at Norrsken**


A job at Norrsken is like working at a startup: It’s fast-paced and exciting. Tasks and challenges may be demanding and responsibilities may change over time. In return, we guarantee that we will fast-forward your personal and professional development, through projects you will be proud of having contributed to.


We believe in radical transparency and aim to honour this in our recruitment processes. For more perspective on what it’s like to work at Norrsken, read our Employee Value Proposition here and Culture Foundation here.

#### **Salary & benefits**


This role is based out of Norrsken House Stockholm and you'll be reporting to our Creative Director. Salary is 38 000 SEK/month, 35 vacation days, solid pension program and insurance with additional private health insurance and parental pay.

**We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as recruitment is ongoing. We'll begin interviews after June 13th 2025.**

title: UX Writer (m/f/d)
description:
**Everything we do, starts with you.** 
 Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone's future financial growth.
   

  

**We are looking for a**
**UX Writer (m/f/d)**
**(full-time) Join our team at our location in Amsterdam, Heerenveen or Berlin - flexible working conditions available**
**What will you do:**
 As a UX writer at Riverty, you’ll help our users understand and navigate our service across all channels and touchpoints. You will help connect and unify user journeys across the Riverty app, web shop checkouts, invoicing, payments, and more.
   

  

 You’ll join our very international UX team of designers, researchers, and two fellow UX writers, where you will be an advocate for purpose-driven dialogs and user-centric language and communication.
   

  

 Your time will mainly be spent developing and refining the app and email content – think of invoices, payment reminders, and microcopy. You’ll work closely with UX designers, product managers, and developers on creating, adjusting, and implementing content across different products and user journeys. A part of your time will also be set aside for more strategic UX writing work, such as establishing and maintaining guidelines, building a content design system, setting up processes, conducting workshops, and other initiatives to help UX writing at Riverty shine as a discipline.
   

  

**You will succeed in this role if you have the following skills** 
**:**
* Product Writing Proficiency: If you haven’t worked as a UX writer before, you are an experienced copywriter, content marketer, technical writer, etc.
* Content Design: Capable of conceptualizing and structuring clear, concise, and persuasive content for various digital platforms that meets audience needs and enhances user experience.
* Collaboration: Experienced in working with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and developers.
* Communication: Proficient in simplifying complex ideas for diverse audiences, using various writing styles to inform, persuade, or entertain.
* Strategic Thinking: Understands how wording affects overall goals and can develop plans for effective content management that aligns with organizational objectives.
* Affinity with Research: If you haven’t done UX or consumer research or conducted user interviews in a past role, you really want to learn.
* Content Design: Capable of conceptualizing and structuring engaging content that meets audience needs and enhances user experience.
* Dutch or German and English Fluency: preferably, you are a native Dutch or German speaker and have fluency in English.


**And some nice to have:**
* We would be especially excited if you have any of the following (if not, we’re also enthusiastic if you learn with us)
* Additional proficiency and writing experience in an additional language such as German, Swedish, Danish, French, Finnish, or another European language.
* Experience developing voice & tone guidelines, working with content design systems, components, or other content management and governance forms.
* Exposure to complex product ecosystems, including B2B, B2C, or B2B2C products.
* Familiarity with accessibility standards and their application in design.
* Experience with localization or working with Crowdin or other translation tools.
* A background in linguistics.
* You’re excited about content-first design.


 #EUR10
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
   

  

 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.
* Find, together with engineers, the most efficient trade-off between high-value solutions for users and the complexity of implementation.
* Leverage usage data to evaluate the impact of your designs, and apply your learnings to the next iterations.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
   

  

 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.
* Find, together with engineers, the most efficient trade-off between high-value solutions for users and the complexity of implementation.
* Leverage usage data to evaluate the impact of your designs, and apply your learnings to the next iterations.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: Product Designer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
*Var med och forma framtiden för Fortnox finansiella tjänster med nya lösningar för företagslån, betalningar,* 
 bank och fakturatjänster!
   

  

 Vi går en spännande tid till mötes för våra designers på Fortnox då vår designfunktion framöver kommer att ta en mycket mer central roll i bolagets strategiska utveckling. Vi söker nu produktdesigners som vill vara med på, och bidra till denna omställning och hjälpa oss att skapa en sömlös och engagerande användarupplevelse i toppklass.
   

  

**Mer specifikt kommer du att:**
* Ingå i ett tvärfunktionellt team och ansvara för användarupplevelsen.
* Samarbeta nära produkt-, och utveckling och involvera dem i designarbetet. riva UX-research genom olika tekniker, exempelvis fokusgrupper, intervjuer, observation och A/B-tester.
* Vara en nyckelperson i dialogen med utvecklare för att säkerställa att designbeslut och UI-komponenter implementeras med kvalitet och precision.
* Skapa prototyper och mockups, och utveckla koncept- och interaktionsdesign som inspirerar och engagerar våra användare.
* Kartlägga, utforma och utveckla användarresor som produkten ingår i, och säkerställa att vi har en väl fungerande och sammanhängande upplevelse.
* Skriva och bidra med genomtänkt och användarcentrerad UX-copy.
* Vi söker dig som
* Brinner för produktdesign och har förmågan att bidra genom hela designprocessen.
* Du har några års erfarenhet av att jobba med Design, UI/UX och research. Du rapporterar till och arbetar nära design-områdes chefen men är bekväm med att självständigt ta initiativ, planera och genomföra ditt arbete.
* Har jobbat med agil produktutveckling och tror på snabba iterationer och kontinuerligt lärande.
* Har erfarenhet av datadrivet arbete med både kvalitativ och kvantitativ data.
* Har ett kreativt sinne och en naturlig fallenhet för användbarhet, flöden, färg och form.
* Har förmågan att översätta användarnas behov och designa lösningar som ligger i linje med såväl användarnas önskemål som Fortnox affärsplan.
* Har kunskap i designteori och kan arbeta strukturerat enligt designprinciper, metoder och verktyg.
* Är kommunikativ och känner sig bekväm att dela sina tillvägagångssätt och resultat med kollegor och stakeholders i organisationen.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder**
 På Fortnox bygger teamen sin egen teamkultur och ramverk. Som produktdesigner hos oss kommer du att ingå i ett autonomt team som själv styr över sina arbetsprocesser och releaser av sina egna tjänster i en stimulerande domän. Du kommer att arbeta i skärpunkten mellan det beprövade, stabila och det nya, spännande. Du kommer därför att ha möjlighet att utvecklas genom att jobba tillsammans med erfarna och kompetenta kollegor, samt ha stor möjlighet att påverka hur vi designar våra produkter framåt.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter flexibilitet och möjligheten att arbeta på distans, samtidigt som vi strävar efter att skapa en inspirerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö för våra medarbetare. Vårt team är fördelat över kontoren i Malmö, Växjö och Stockholm, vilket innebär att din arbetsdag kommer att vara en kombination av digitalt och fysiskt arbete. På våra kontor ses vi 2–3 dagar i veckan, och vi söker dig som trivs med att också vara på plats med jämna mellanrum!
   

  

**Om Fortnox**
*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* 
*www.fortnox.se* 
*.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Marketing Designer
description:
Are you ready to shape the visual identity of our games and bring them to life across a wide range of platforms? As a Marketing Designer, you’ll play a key role in crafting high-quality marketing content, advertising assets, and brand material that reflects and elevates the vision of our titles.
   

  

 You’ll be working alongside a passionate team of creatives, producers, and directors to ensure consistency and excellence across all visual outputs. You'll bring a strong design aesthetic, a deep familiarity with Unreal Engine and Adobe Suite, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

 Please note that this role is full-time and permanent. Location: HQ Stockholm Sweden.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Designing and developing compelling marketing and branding materials for our AAA games;
* Creating and presenting visual styles into promotional content across social media, digital advertising, and presentations
* Collaborating closely with producers, leads, and cross-functional teams to maintain high creative standards;
* Creating visual assets and material for product pitches, social media, newsletters, events, blogs, webinars and digital campaigns
* Managing time effectively across multiple projects and meeting tight deadlines with precision
* Participate in design choices and communicate with peers, managers and vendors
* Work with, understand and utilise an established visual style of our games


**Requirements:**
* 3+ years of professional experience as a Designer in games, advertising, or branding
* A strong portfolio showcasing a broad range of styles and a refined eye for composition, typography, and layout
* Advanced knowledge of Adobe Suite and strong experience working in Unreal Engine
* Solid understanding of brand development, iconography, and storytelling through visuals
* Fluent in English with excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Passion for games and a willingness to work across various genres and visual styles.


**Desirables:**
* Experience working on integrated marketing campaigns and brand launches;
* Familiarity with motion graphics or video editing tools


 This role is ideal for someone with a proactive mindset, who takes ownership of their craft and thrives in a collaborative, creative environment. If you're looking to join a team where your visual storytelling skills can shine, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**Interview process:**
* 30-minute introductory video call with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
* 60-minute video call with our Creative Director
* 60-minute onsite interview (for those that are local) or video call with the Marketing Art Director and the Graphic Designer


**About Starbreeze**
 At Starbreeze, we believe games are more than just entertainment—they’re a way to bring people together. From the pulse-pounding, cooperative heists of PAYDAY to our upcoming Dungeons & Dragons adventure, we create experiences that thrive on teamwork, strategy, and the thrill of emergent gameplay. Our mission is to build vibrant games that offer infinite replayability, allowing players to forge their own stories and adventures together.
   

  

 Every Starbreeze employee helps shape this vision. Whether you’re crafting intricate game worlds or developing the systems that bring players together, your creativity and passion will drive the future of cooperative gaming. Join us in our journey to create innovative, immersive experiences that unite players and redefine what gaming can achieve.
   

  

 Starbreeze values diversity and inclusion, and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome you as who you are, no matter where you are from or what games you play. If there are preparations or accommodations that we can make to help ensure that you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.
   

  

**What more do we offer?**
 Competitive salaries with annual reviews, generous occupational pension, and referral bonuses.
   

  

 Comprehensive benefits, including private medical insurance, annual wellness benefit, and 30 days of paid vacation.
   

  

 Unique perks such as free monthly office massages, weekly D&D club and other fun activities!
   

  

 Sound good? Then we can’t wait to see your CV and look forward to meeting you. We recommend that you apply as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continuously. Please submit your CV and cover letter in English.
   

  

*Recruitment agencies may not submit CVs through this website or directly to hiring managers. Starbreeze Entertainment does not accept unsolicited recruitment agency CVs, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with us.*

title: Lead Product Designer
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**About The Role 🤸‍♀️**
 Juni is at an inflection point.
   

  

 We have spent our first four years building the foundations of a different type of business bank. One that makes finance easy and allows our customers to focus on doing what they do best - building their business. However, there was a trade off. What we gained in speed of delivery required a sacrifice in cohesiveness of our user experience.
   

  

 We now want to take a step back and stitch everything we have built together into one holistic, intuitive, and enjoyable user experience.
   

  

 This is where you come in.
   

  

 We are looking for a Principal/Lead Product Designer to take charge of everything design at Juni.
   

  

 Someone who can build and lead a team of talented designers who thrive on delivering exciting work. Someone who can be a champion for the user, building experiences that work for them, even if they break the “norms”. Someone who can lead multiple projects concurrently and collaborate with everyone from frontend engineers to legal.
   

  

 In short, someone capable of building a bold vision, get buy-in from the rest of the company, and deliver it.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
* Build and lead a talented, diverse, and inclusive team of designers who thrive on delivering exceptional work across a variety of design disciplines
* Shape and articulate a design vision that inspires and aligns teams across Juni, helping to shape and define priorities
* Collaborate with product, engineering, data, legal & compliance, and more to deliver solutions that are impactful across markets and platforms
* Manage multiple projects and scale resources effectively, ensuring teams have clear, measurable goals and the support needed to achieve them
* Be endlessly curious, and bring the latest knowledge, insights, and trends of desktop, mobile, and other design disciplines into Juni


**Within 1 Month, You'll**
* Familiarise yourself with our existing design principles and design patterns
* Build relationships with team members across Product, Engineering, and others
* Conduct a UX audit to explore pain points and opportunity areas in the short, medium, and long term


**Within 3 Months, You'll**
* Create/revise design org structures and processes that equip your team to succeed
* Build on and expand the existing design vision for Juni, across Web and Mobile
* Be a champion for our users, with a deep understanding of their needs and pain points
* Collaborate with product and engineering to start shaping priorities


**Within 6 Months, You'll**
* Have a finalised design vision that we are starting to see in the live product
* Get the reformed design team fully up to speed and delivering polished designs that work with cross-platform flows
* Foster a thriving design culture where talent grows, creativity flourishes, and team members feel empowered to do their best work


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Figma
* Hotjar
* Amplitude
* Slack
* G-suite
* Notion


**Qualifications 👑**
*What we need to see*
 Product Design experience
   

  

* 10 years of experience in product design, preferably within design led companies, with a portfolio of projects you can use to showcase your skills
* 5 years of experience leading and managing design teams and owning overarching design vision
* Strong execution and understanding of all the core design skills, including UX design, UI/visual design, Interaction design, UX copywriting, Information architecture


 General experience
   

  

* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions convincingly.
* Experience working in a fast-paced environment
* A tuned product sense, ensuring you quickly understand who our users are, what problems they have, and use that to inform your designs
* In-depth experience collaborating with disparate teams (engineering, product, legal, marketing, and more) and bringing all of their insights to your design
* Ability to learn - We know you don’t know everything, we don’t expect you to, but we do want to know you can pick up complex concepts quickly and incorporate them into your designs
* Ability to mentor - You may be the expert in your field, but we don’t want you to carry all the responsibility. We want to know you can share the knowledge and upskill your wider team


*What we’d love to see*
* Familiarity with multiple research techniques to gather qualitative and quantitative data (usability testing, card sorting, A/B testing, etc)
* Familiarity with fintech, banking and/or financial services (preferably from Sweden)
* Familiarity with motion and animation design (from a product design point of view)


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Senior Growth Marketer
description:
Are you a seasoned B2B marketer driven to optimize website traffic and conversions? Do you thrive in global B2B SaaS scaleups? Then we have a very exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Paligo is a fast-growing SaaS company offering a cloud-based Component Content Management System (CCMS), with an ARR of +$10m. Our platform enables global collaboration in creating, managing, translating, and publishing technical documentation.
   

  

 With over 450 customers across 37 countries, we serve both global enterprises and national businesses including eClinical, Emerson Electric, Washington Post, Mitsubishi, and Sitecore. Our mission is to become the #1 CCMS provider by delivering an outstanding product, proving ROI, and ensuring a great customer experience.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be responsible for both organic and paid traffic acquisition and conversion optimization on our website. And as one of the most critical challenges that's on the rise for marketers is zero click searches, your role will have the opportunity to develop strategies for Paligo’s appearance in AI / LLM driven research and how we appear in AI overviews in search engines.
   

  

 You will also become a key stakeholder in developing both SEO and SEM capabilities for today’s competitive search engine landscape.
   

  

 To get improved visibility, traffic and conversions, you will work closely with our Marketing Manager and Content Writer, the Revenue Operations team, Product UX team and Digital Designer. You will report to the VP of Marketing.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
* Own and optimize Paligo’s website, by driving quality, targeted traffic to the site and optimizing conversions
* Stay on top of how our market and audiences are using AI chatbots to research us, and drive Paligo’s visibility in ChatGPT, Perplexity, Claude, Gemini etc.
* Optimize how we rank in organic search results
* Manage paid search (Google and Microsoft) and optimize their results
* Manage Linkedin Ads and our affiliates (industry influences and organizations, industry news sites etc).
* For the right person there is also an opportunity to take over and level up our ABM program where Marketing supports our outbounding program through display advertising.


 Your goal is to drive Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs), resulting in a high-velocity sales pipeline
   

  

**About You**
* 5-10 years in digital marketing
* Bachelor/Masters or the equivalent experience
* Hands-on skills in running and optimizing B2B websites with a strong interest in traffic acquisition and conversions
* Strong skills in B2B search behaviour
* Experience in paid channels like Google Ads and Linkedin Ads
* Experience in Wordpress, Google Analytics, Hubspot, Google Ads, Microsoft Ads
* Demonstrated understanding of how AI tools like ChatGPT, Perplexity and Gemini impact search behavior in B2B SaaS


**What We Offer**
 At Paligo, you’ll be at the heart of a fast-growing, global SaaS company where your work makes a real impact. You’ll be challenged, supported, and given space to grow.
   

  

 We stay connected through regular team check-ins and informal Google Meet sessions, and we believe in open communication, shared learning, and supporting each other along the way.
   

  

 We offer flexible hours, partial remote working, health-promoting initiatives, and competitive benefits — because balance matters. If this sounds like a place where you'd thrive, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Please note: A background check will be conducted on the final candidate as part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 Paligo is an end-to-end Component Content Management System (CCMS) solution for technical documentation, policies and procedures, knowledge management, and more.

title: Experiment Specialist – bygg framtidens digitala prenumerationer hos Schibsted
description:
Dynamic Sales and Experiment är ett tillväxtteam på Schibsted som blandar data, teknik och kreativitet för att skapa nästa generations digitala prenumeranter. Varje vecka testar vi nya idéer på plattformar som Aftonbladet, Svenska Dagbladet, VG, Aftenposten, E24 med flera.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en nyfiken och analytisk Experiment Specialist till vårt nordiska team i Oslo eller Stockholm.
   

  

 Vad gör rollen unik:
   

  

* Miljoner sidvisningar att testa på. Hos Aftonbladet, Svenska Dagbladet, VG, Aftenposten, E24 och flera får du köra experiment i realtid på skandinaviens största medieplattformar.
* Datadriven kultur. Du får toppmoderna verktyg för A/B-testning, maskininlärning och personalisering - och en professionell miljö som älskar att dela kunskap.
* Direkt påverkan. Ett lyckat experiment kan öka våra intäkter markant och rullas ut till miljontals användare.


 Vår vision är att skapa framtidens prenumerationstjänster och du kommer att ha en nyckelroll i detta. Vi tror att du är bra på problemlösning och har ett analytiskt sinne. Din roll är att säkerställa att vi förbättrar och utvecklar våra produkter genom att planera, genomföra och analysera experiment i olika kanaler.
   

  

 Vad du kommer att göra:
   

  

* Formulera hypoteser. T.ex. "Vad händer om vi rekommenderar prenumeration till X direkt efter Y?"
* Experimentera. Planera, designa och lansera experiment.
* Bygga dynamiska säljsidor. Bygga säljsidor anpassat efter kunder hos Norge och Sveriges största medier, samt vara med och utveckla nya prenumerationstjänster
* Analysera resultat. Använda Amplitude, Tableau, Snowflake och/eller Python för att kvantifiera lönsamheten.
* Skala framgångsrika case. Samarbeta med utvecklare, designers och andra för att skala vinnare i större volym och över varumärken.


**Låter detta intressant?**
 Vi var inte världsmästare på A/B-testning, webbutveckling, analys eller experimentdesign när vi började. Det viktigaste är att du har teknisk och kommersiell förståelse och stor aptit på att lära dig nya saker. Vårt team har olika bakgrunder och expertområden, så du kommer att passa in i teamet oavsett om du är generalist eller har en specifik expertkompetens.
   

  

 I vår portfölj har vi produkter som folk älskar i både Norge och Sverige, vilket ger oss enormt mycket trafik att testa på. Du kommer att få värdefull och unik praktisk erfarenhet av experimentering som inte många i Norge eller Sverige kan erbjuda.
   

  

 Tjänsten är utlyst både i Stockholm och i Oslo.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden
   

  

* Identifiera viktiga utvecklingsområden och experimentera med lösningar som ger önskad effekt. Ta en uppgift från idé till genomfört experiment.
* Drivkraft för systematisk experimentering, A/B-testning och effektdokumentation för optimering i alla delar av kundresan, med avsikt att konvertera kunder eller förbättra andra nyckeltal.
* Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team med ansvar för att aktiviteterna utförs med ett LEAN-tänk och har en dokumenterad effekt kopplad till relevanta mätetal.
* Göra analyser på användardata för att få insikt om hur våra initiativ påverkar våra användare.
* Presentera resultat och fynd på ett strukturerat, exakt och begripligt sätt – både skriftligt och muntligt.


**Vi letar efter dig som har**
* Utbildning från högskola eller universitet.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom a/b-testning, webbdesign, utveckling av landningssidor och/eller analys.
* Kunskap om utveckling av landningssidor, betalväggar, low-code verktyg, JavaScript, HTML och CSS är en fördel (alternativt andra språk som Python eller SQL).
* Erfarenhet av kvantitativ testning (hypotestestning, a/b-testning, CRO, enkäter).
* Resultatorienterad, analytisk och får saker gjorda.
* God förståelse för kundbehov och användarupplevelse.
* Erfarenhet av designverktyg som Sketch, Figma eller Adobe XD är en fördel.
* Förmåga att sammanfatta och förmedla resultat tydligt och strukturerat.


 Om du känner igen dig i något av detta uppmanar vi dig att söka. Vårt team är tvärfunktionellt och består av ekonomer, ux-designers, marknadsförare och en data scientist.
   

  

 Vi vill erbjuda dig
   

  

* En arbetsmiljö som kombinerar kreativitet och datadrivna processer.
* Möjlighet att bli en resurs inom experimentering och analys.
* Möjlighet att utveckla tvärfunktionell kompetens inom företagsekonomi, experimentering och analys.
* Fina kontor i Oslo eller Stockholm, med bra faciliteter och duktiga kollegor.
* En flexibel, hybrid och informell arbetsmiljö.
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och förmåner, samt goda karriärmöjligheter.


 Tjänsten rapporterar till Manager of Dynamic Sales and Experiments.

title: Embedded Developer
description:
At Sii Sweden we partner with some of the most forward-thinking companies across industries such as automotive, healthcare, life-science and banking.
 



 As an Embedded Software Developer at Sii, you won’t just write code—you’ll contribute to the success of diverse, high-impact projects that demand both deep technical knowledge and creative problem-solving; you’ll play a key role in delivering tailored solutions that meet client’s unique requirements.
 



 Joining us means working in a collaborative, consultancy-driven environment so If you're excited by challenge, and the opportunity to grow alongside some of the best engineers in the field, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Design and implement software architecture for embedded systems
* Develop robust applications using C++ and Qt/QML for device interfaces and control logic
* Work on hardware-related programming, including device drivers
* Design, build, and debug embedded Linux environments (GNU/Linux) for various hardware platforms
* Write scripts and tools in Python (or equivalent) to support development, testing, and automation
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, QA, and UX designers
* Contribute to design reviews, documentation, and system integration activities



  





**Requirements** 



* Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
* Solid experience with C++ in embedded system environments
* Strong knowledge of Qt/QML for UI and application layer development
* Experience with GNU/Linux system development and configuration
* Hands-on knowledge of hardware-level programming
* Familiarity with scripting in Python or a similar language
* Proficiency in embedded systems architecture and real-time constraints
* Ability to debug complex software/hardware interactions

title: Cybersäkerhetssamordnare
description:
**Har du tidigare erfarenhet av att jobba med informations- och cybersäkerhetsstrategier? Är du en driven, engagerad och kommunikativ ledare med strategisk höjd? Vi söker en cybersäkerhetssamordnare som blir kravställare mot it-organisationen, dess drift och verksamhet. Bli vår nya kollega!**



I rollen som cybersäkerhetsamordnare kommer du att ansvara för att leda, samordna och utveckla myndighetens övergripande cybersäkerstrategi och dess genomförande. Du samverkar kontinuerligt med informationssäkerhet. En del av arbetet innebär att du identifierar risker och behov inom verksamheten, utvecklar åtgärds- och arbetsplaner som hanterar cyberrisker samt säkerställer en passande säkerhets- och resilience-nivå för myndigheten.



Du arbetar med kravställning och vägledning inom cybersäkerhetsfrågor gentemot it, samt stödjer projekt och verksamhet med din kompetens. Du agerar som rådgivare till myndighetens ledning, chefer och medarbetare i cybersäkerhetsfrågor.



Organisatoriskt ingår rollen i staben för avdelningen **Myndighetsstöd**, där du rapporterar till avdelningschefen. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med informationssäkerhet, it och säkerhetsskydd.



Dina arbetsuppgifter innebär att du:


* ingår i och arbetar med den grupp som äger, förvaltar och utvecklar myndighetens ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet (LIS)
* ansvarar för att utveckla och implementera en cybersäkerhetsstrategi
* är kravställande mot it, dess drift och verksamhet samt stödjer dess framtida utveckling (informations- och cybersäkerhet)
* identifierar, utvärderar och hanterar säkerhetsrisker som kan påverka organisationens informationssystem, vilket innebär att övervaka cyberhot och säkerhetsincidenter, samt att vidta åtgärder för att minimera skador
* säkerställer att organisationen följer lagar och regler samt interna policies
* i samverkan implementerar NIS2 samt samverkar med andra i GDPR-arbetet
* säkerställer snabba och effektiva åtgärder för att minimera skada vid cybersäkerhetsincidenter
* bidrar till att öka medvetenhet och kunskap inom myndigheten för att främja en god säkerhetskultur.


**Vi söker dig som har**


* en högskoleutbildning inom it, datavetenskap, teknik eller säkerhetsområdet alternativt annan relevant utbildning kombinerad med flerårig kvalificerad arbetslivserfarenhet inom cybersäkerhetsområdet
* flerårigaktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av att strukturerat arbeta med informations- och cybersäkerhet ur både ett strategiskt och operativt perspektiv där du fungerat som rådgivande till organisation och ledning
* erfarenhet av DRP och BCM arbete, samt kunskap inom teknisk resiliens och redundans
* god kunskap kopplat till metodik, lagstiftning och ramverk
* mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.


**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av/kunskap om:**


* arbete med cybersäkerhetsfrågor inom offentlig förvaltning
* att leda/samordna förmågeförflyttning inom cybersäkerhetsförmågan, t ex samordna gapanalys och behovsinventering, upphandling, byggt upp security operations centers (SOC)
* de tjänster och verktyg (mjukvara och plattformar) som finns på cybersäkerhetsmarknaden, samt erfarenhet av molnfrågor och tjänster
* informationssäkerhetsarbete, LIS och ISO 27001
* arbete som projektledare
* Säkerhetsskyddslagen och samverkan med säkerhetsskyddsarbetet
* att jobba i enlighet med certifieringar såsom CISSP, CISA, CCSP, CRISC eller liknande
* ramverk som NIST CSF v2 och MSB:s metodstöd
* utbildning inom informationssäkerhetsområdet.


**Personliga egenskaper**  

Dina personliga egenskaper är mycket viktiga för oss och vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. Det är viktigt att du är en driven, engagerad och kommunikativ ledare med en strategisk höjd. För rollen krävs även hög integritet, ett gott säkerhetsmedvetande samt att du är trygg i att hantera sekretess. Du arbetar bra med andra människor, relaterar till dem på ett lyhört sätt samt löser konflikter på ett konstruktivt vis.



Vi förutsätter att du har en hög säkerhetsmedvetenhet och att du kan arbeta enligt, såväl Vår värdegrund - Strålsäkerhetsmyndigheten (stralsakerhetsmyndigheten.se) som den Statliga värdegrunden (forvaltningskultur.se)


**Vi erbjuder dig**  

Hos oss har du flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att arbeta på distans. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård och läkemedel.



Som medarbetare på Strålsäkerhetsmyndigheten har du ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag! Tillsammans arbetar vi för ett strålsäkert samhälle.


**Anställningsvillkor**  

Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning med start enligt överenskommelse. Anställningen kan komma att inledas med provanställning i sex månader. Placeringsort är Solna. Resor i tjänsten förekommer.



Vissa av våra arbetsuppgifter är placerade i säkerhetsklass, vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs även svenskt medborgarskap.



Du kan komma att ingå i myndighetens krisorganisation och kan även komma att krigsplaceras vid myndigheten. Krisorganisationen utför strålskyddsbedömningar och kärntekniska analyser och samverkar med andra berörda aktörer för att hantera radiologiska nödsituationer, inklusive situationer vid höjd beredskap. Inom ramarna förkrisorganisationen kommer du att ingå i den insatsberedskap som myndigheten upprätthåller för att stötta andra aktörer i samhället med strålningsmätningar.


**Kontakt och ansökan**  

Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen? Kontakta Ronnie Nilsson, avdelningschef, 08-799 41 57, Annika Kjerrman, hr, 08-799 43 75 eller Ann Charlotte Odengran, hr, 08-799 40 91.



Fackliga företrädare är Mathias Häggblom, Saco-S, 08-799 44 85, och Michael Wallin, ST, 08-799 42 87.



Välkommen med din ansökan via vår hemsida **senast den 3 juli 2025.**


***-***


**Strålsäkerhetsmyndigheten** arbetar pådrivande och förebyggande för att skydda människor och miljö från oönskade effekter av strålning. Våra cirka 340 medarbetare har djupa och breda kunskaper inom strålskydd och kärnsäkerhet. Myndigheten har kontor i Solna, Katrineholm och Göteborg.

title: IT Delivery Manager Digital Enterprise Solutions, URGENT, Remote working (h/f)
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****4-6 months**
  
**Are you a Delivery Manager with strong ITSM experience in a large global environment and available immediately?**
===================================================================================================================


Then emagine need you to play a crucial role in optimizing the delivery of Finance, HR & Procurement IT services for an international high tech organisation.

**Key Requirements**  

All candidates must meet the following essential qualifications:

* In-depth knowledge of IT Service Management (ITSM) and ITIL principles.
* High-level understanding of Finance & HR business processes.
* Strong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration.
* Proficiency in English (written and spoken); French is a plus.
* Experience with BMC Helix tool preferred.
* Excellent communication skills, especially in explaining technical solutions.
* Proactive and independent working style.
* Extensive experience as a Delivery Manager or in a similar IT service role.
* Experience in leading cross-functional teams.
* Familiarity with service performance metrics.
* Experience in a global IT environment.

**Main Responsibilities**  

The IT Delivery Manager will oversee the governance and processes vital for service delivery.


Key responsibilities include:

* Monitoring service performance metrics, including KPI/SLA/XLA, and managing Service Improvement plans.
* Conducting Major Incident Management and Root Cause Analysis.
* Identifying areas for continuous improvement in processes and tools.
* Maintaining and optimizing the Service Catalog.
* Developing and updating IT service documentation and operational procedures.
* Facilitating clear communication between DES teams and business stakeholders.
* Supporting change management initiatives to ensure adherence to processes.
* Collaborating with other service delivery managers to drive best practices and process harmonization.

**Other Details**  

Start date: ASAP URGENT.  

Duration: 3 Months +. Remote work within Europe. Tariff: €470.


Apply or reach out to Brendan with your questions

Delivery Specialist

title: Erfaren IT-projektledare
description:
**Din nya roll**  

Som projektledare hos oss leder du ett team där ni tillsammans utvecklar lösningar med och för våra kunder. Du leder antingen ett något större systemutvecklingsprojekt eller flera mindre. Teamen består oftast av helt egen personal och bedrivs i våra lokaler, undantag finns där åtaganden drivs hos kund.  

Vi har en familjär anda där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Miljön präglas av framåtanda, högt i tak och ett stort intresse av teknik och utveckling.


**Hur vi ser på arbetet i team**  

Den vision vi strävar mot är att vara Sveriges mest eftertraktade team – både i betydelsen att kunderna vill anlita oss och att de bästa talangerna vill jobba hos oss. För det är teamet som är det allra viktigaste för oss, det är i team vi gör våra leveranser och formulerar våra råd till kunderna. Och det är i teamet vi delar kunskap, finner gemenskap och formulerar idéerna som lyfter oss alla.


**Om dig**  

Du har mångårig arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda systemutvecklingsprojekt eller förvaltningar som inbegriper löpande utveckling och då främst i kundleveranssituationer.



Du är organiserad, har hög kommunikativ förmåga och kan anpassa din kommunikation beroende på mottagare. Det innebär att du kan samtala om tekniska lösningar på ett tydligt och enkelt sätt till både kunder och kollegor. Du har även en förmåga att bygga och underhålla starka relationer med kunder och kollegor genom att vara lyhörd, empatisk och konstruktiv i ditt sätt att kommunicera. Flytande svenska i tal och skrift är också viktigt för rollen.


**Erfarenhet och kompetenser**  

- Minst 5 års erfarenhet av projekt- eller förvaltningsledning i IT-organisation  

* Erfarenhet av tekniknära arbete i IT-projekt
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom Data/IT, eller motsvarande kompetens
* Projektledningscertifiering eller liknande utbildning
* Arbetat med sprintar, dagliga standups, demos inför release och retros efter release
* Förståelse för produkter från Atlassian, exempelvis Confluence och Jira
* Hög kommunikativ förmåga
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling, utredningar, analyser och processutveckling.


**Vad vi erbjuder**  

Vi erbjuder ett stimulerande, utmanande och flexibelt arbetsklimat i en familjär anda där du har möjlighet att utvecklas och växa inom företaget.



Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: First Line IT Support
description:
**Har du ett tekniskt intresse och brinner för att lösa problem? Som supporttekniker hos oss får du hjälpa våra företagskunder med stort som smått och ingå i ett fantastiskt team på en kreativ arbetsplats. Om detta låter som något för dig, tveka inte att söka!**



För att kunna leverera lokal IT-drift i världsklass behöver vi engagerade medarbetare som vill växa tillsammans med oss. Vi söker nu en supporttekniker till vår First Line Support som brinner för att ge bra service och att hjälpa våra företagskunder. Du kommer att ingå i ett härligt team där du som har högt kundfokus och är lösningsorienterad kommer att trivas extra bra. Tekniskt intresse är viktigt men ännu viktigare är viljan att utvecklas och förmågan att lära dig nya saker. Vi vill leverera en kundupplevelse över förväntan, därför söker vi dig som är engagerad, nyfiken, nytänkande och positiv.



Denna tjänst gäller dagtid under kontorstimmar och den främsta kundkontakten sker på svenska. På vår supportavdelning får du via telefon och ärenden i vårt ärendehanteringssystem hantera löpande frågor från våra kunder runt om i Norden.


**Som IT-supporttekniker på Shibuya får du:**


* Hjälpa våra kunder med IT-problem via telefon och ärenden
* Säkra en högklassig leverans och kundnöjdhet
* Lära dig att arbeta i Microsoft klientmiljö samt därtill kringliggande produkter
* Registrera ärenden utifrån basrutiner och grundläggande frågeställningar
* Administrera konton och behörighetsaccesser
* Hantera beställningar och agera problemlösare

  
* Har arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT och Servicedesk.
* Kunskaper i Windows och Officepaketet
* Är lösningsorienterad
* Är noggrann och strukturerad i ditt arbetssätt
* Är prestigelös, då vi jobbar i team är detta en självklarhet för oss
* Är en sann lagspelare
* Har en serviceinriktad personlighet som gillar att ta eget ansvar
* Har en god kommunikativ förmåga
* Kan svenska flytande både i tal och skift
Kan engelska mycket väl i tal och skrift  
* 

**Ett plus om du även har:**


* Några års erfarenhet inom serviceyrken
* Relevant utbildning med inriktning mot teknik
* Goda kunskaper gällande ITIL och gärna certifierad inom ITIL Foundation
* Körkort


**Varför ska du jobba hos oss?**



För oss är det superviktigt att du trivs på jobbet. Därför har vi satsat mycket på vår fysiska och sociala arbetsmiljö och att det ska vara roligt att gå till jobbet. Vi tror att glada medarbetare ger oss nöjdare kunder och vi letar hela tiden efter nya sätt att utmana varandra i att växa och bli bättre. Att vi delar med oss av vår kunskap och erfarenhet är en självklarhet för oss, något som gör att vi ständigt utvecklas både som organisation och som medarbetare.


**Placeringsort:** Tjänsten har huvudplaceringsort i Borås


**Låter det intressant?**  

Om du vill vara med oss på vår resa framåt så tveka inte att söka tjänsten. Vi tillämpar ett löpande urval så skicka in ansökan redan idag.


En miljö präglad av utveckling och innovation


Fokus på ett hållbart arbetsliv


Unik position på marknaden


Fantastiska utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter


En dynamisk organisation där alla bidrar


Personliga möten och ett långsiktigt tänk


Bra förmåner och en del av en stark koncern


**OM FÖRETAGET**
----------------

Shibuya skapades våren 2020 genom samgående mellan de erfarna techbolagen Pulsen Production och Shibuya Crossing och är en av Sveriges främsta aktörer inom verksamhetskritisk IT.


Vi levererar tjänster inom bland annat datacenterinfrastruktur och IT-drift, säkra kommunikationslösningar, service och support 24/7, säkerhetslösningar, applikationsdrift och tredjepartsservice.


Shibuya har strategiska partnerskap med ledande tillverkare och referenslösningar hos flera av Nordens mest krävande IT-verksamheter i både den privata och offentliga sektorn. Bolaget är certifierat enligt ISO 14001, 9001 och 27001.


Shibuya är en del av Pulsenkoncernen har ca 120 medarbetare vid kontoren i Borås, Stockholm, Alingsås, Göteborg och Ulricehamn

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Software: Fuel for mobility**
-------------------------------

  

We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------


**SW engineer within Cybersecurity development****.**

  




We are an integral part of the Software Engineering function within a department called as Common Base Technologies. We are responsible for developing and maintaining technical cybersecurity solutions inside our vehicles, (not corporate or cloud security), and are looking for a new working colleague that can join with us.

**What you'll do**
------------------



To succeed in this role, it is most important that you are a curious quick learner who enjoys diving into new things. In this role, you will collaborate with many different people cross our organisation, we see that you have excellent collaboration and communication skills and enjoy working in a team.

  



Moreover, you should have a MSc education in, data technology, software engineering, electronics or similar, combined with a few years of relevant working experience within Automotive data communication, (testing, development, system design).

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

  


In this role, you have experience in C/C++, Test system experience, Android/QNX or any POSIX OS, SOMEIP/UDS, Python/Bash Scripting, Embedded systems, Automotive/Infotainment/cybersecurity, Autosar, Diagnostics, machine learning. Cybersecurity should preferably be one of your strong skills and main interest to continue to develop.



We believe that you are fluent in English, spoken and in writing.

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
--------------------------------

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.



If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to divyashri.prakash.kartik@volvocars.com



Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. We’re excited to get to know you!


**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.



And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!



#LI-DNP


#LI-DNI

title: Technical System Specialist HRIS to Scandic Hotels Group
description:
Do you have a strong technical foundation and a passion for building smart, scalable HR tech solutions? At Scandic Hotels Tech, we’re now looking for a System Specialist to join our Team Member Journey – a tech team dedicated to supporting and developing the digital tools that shape the experience for our team members.



In this role, you’ll work hands-on with integrations, APIs, system configurations, and data flows across platforms like Workday, Quinyx, GetAccept, and Payroll systems. You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders in HR and Payroll, but your focus will be on the technical side – ensuring our HRIS landscape is robust, integrated, and future-proof.



As a System Specialist within HRIS, you will play a key role in taking several applications to the next level at Scandic. We see great potential in leveraging these tools further at Scandic Hotels Group to enhance productivity and elevate the overall Team Member Experience.


**Main activities and responsibilities:**


* Manage and maintain HRIS environments, including Workday, Quinyx, GetAccept, and Payroll systems.
* Analyze and troubleshoot data flows and integration issues across systems.
* Configure systems and enforce best practices, including automation for improved efficiency.
* Optimize system performance and manage user accounts, licenses, and permissions.
* Provide technical support, troubleshooting, and ensure data security and compliance.
* Develop and maintain HRIS documentation and keep the ITSM tool up to date.
* Deliver training sessions for service desk and key users.
* Support migrations, upgrades, and IT projects related to HRIS.
* Collaborate with vendors, service providers, and internal stakeholders (HR, IT, business units).
* Analyze system usage and performance metrics, identify trends, and recommend improvements.
* Contribute to the development of IT policies and procedures related to HRIS.

  
**Background & skills:**


* Experience from working in an IT organization with responsibility for HR tech systems.
* Hands-on experience with Workday, including setting up and managing integrations with other systems such as payroll, workforce management, and digital signing tools.
* A good understanding of HR master data and how it flows across systems to support business processes.
* Familiarity with a variety of HRIS platforms – experience with Quinyx, SD Worx, and/or GetAccept is a big plus.
* Experience working in multi-country environments, ideally with exposure to Nordic collective agreements and legislation.
* Knowledge of ITIL processes, especially incident and problem management.
* Strong documentation skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Full working proficiency in English and in either Swedish or another Scandinavian language.


**About Scandic Hotels:**

Scandic is the largest Nordic hotel operator with a network of about 280 hotels with 58,000 hotel rooms in operation and under development in six countries. Scandic Friends is the biggest loyalty program in the Nordic hotel sector. A lot of things are boiling at Scandic and we’re looking forward to some exciting and eventful years!



Scandic Hotels is highly committed and proactive when it comes to Diversity & Inclusion initiatives. We are also a responsible corporate citizen and actively engaged in sustainability efforts. We have a long history of driving sustainability action in the hospitality industry. With around 20 000 team members, over 10 million guests and 4 million meetings a year – we have great power to drive transformation and inspire change at scale, for a better and more sustainable tomorrow.



Our HQ is situated in newly renovated spaces, of course with a wonderful hotel vibe, right by Hagaparken on Sveavägen 167 in Stockholm. We love to be in the office but are a flexible workplace and offer a hybrid setup that suits our team members. Join in on our warm and inclusive culture and take part in all our different social activities.


**How****to Apply:**



We’re happy to see that you’ve made it this far, and we can’t wait to get to know you better!


* Applications are welcome in either Swedish or English.
* Please note that we are unable to provide relocation assistance and will only consider applicants already based in Sweden.
* Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and the recruitment may be finalized before the deadline if we find the right candidate.
* Due to GDPR, applications can only be submitted through our website.



We’re excited to hear from you soon!


  
Great Place to Work
Professional and personal development
Partner discounts
Family & Friends discounts
Discounts when eating, drinking & staying with us
Flexible office working hours
Competitive pension scheme


  
We know that we reach further when we assent to our differences. At Scandic we want you to be yourself and develop in the direction you want to go, with the foundation of safe conditions and fair agreements. Bring your experiences, engagement and your way of thinking – contribute to a culture where we genuinely care about each other, our guests and our planet. Welcome to Scandic.



Do you share our values?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

... Scandic was the first hotel chain to ask our guests to re-use their towels. Today, the hang-up-your-towel concept is standard at hotels around the world.
... More than 4 out of 5 of our hotels are eco-labelled and the proportion is growing all the time.
... we only serve coffee that is ecologic, and FairTrade or UTZ-certified.
...thanks to our engagement in sustainability matters we have been named the most sustainable brand in the hotel industry, eleven years in a row, by Sustainable Brand Index.
