Excellent project management skills will be needed. Except for the 2 larger sites Sweden has 3 smaller offices.
* Support management team in arranging different kind of events and meetings, upcoming is the 80 years anniversary and the large customer event in November for 150 customers.
* Support our People team with various administrative tasks concerning e.g. onboarding, offboarding and administering employee benefits
* Working as a point of contact for Sweden when working with all other Office Managers /EAs in the Group. Managing meetings, bookings and synchronizing calendars for Market Team.
* Other administrative tasks depending on business needs



  





**What we are looking for:** 



* Experience from assistant type of tasks
* Positive, proactive and customer focused team player with excellent communication and collaboration skills
* Strong planning and organizational skills with attention to detail, can-do attitude and ability to get things done
* Flexibility and resilience to handle a variety of tasks, balancing multiple tasks and priorities
* Present at the office at least 3 days a week.
* Motivation and ability to add value to different stakeholders by understanding and meeting their needs.
* Desire to learn new things and share own knowledge to others
* Good IT skills e.g. in MS office tools
* Excellent Swedish and fluent English skills both verbally and in writing
* Willingness to work from our Sundbyberg office



  





**About SD Worx :** 




 SD Worx is a leading European provider of Payroll & HR services with global reach. We have offices in Europe and an office in Mauritius. Our goal? We bring people solutions to life. So, companies of any size can turn Human Resources into a source of value for the business and the people in it. Our people solutions span the entire employee journey, from getting people paid to attracting, rewarding, and developing talent. Are you ready to join us?
 



  





**What do we have to offer?** 



* An attractive salary based on your experience and achievement.
* A dynamic environment
* Learning opportunities: through an individual development plan and professional training
* Career growth: whether you want to become more of an expert in your field our you want to expand your knowledge more horizontally, there is always room to grow within SD Worx!



  





 From many places, we work as one, moving from better to best together.
 



 SD Worx lives diversity in the workplace. Diversity provides inspiration and innovation in our company. We particularly welcome applications from qualified talent, regardless of origin, nationality, gender, skin colour, ethnic and social background, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation and stage of life.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Froda is on a mission to revolutionize SME financing by leveraging data, AI, and machine learning to create intelligent, scalable, and efficient financing solutions. As we expand across Europe, we're focused on building cutting-edge credit risk models, fraud detection systems, and automation processes that empower small businesses to thrive.
 



  





 We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the infrastructure and workflows that power data, machine learning, and analytics at Froda.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 To power our growing ambitions, we are expanding our data & ML capabilities. As a Data Engineer at Froda, you’ll play a key role in designing, building and maintaining the infrastructure and workflows that enable machine learning, analytics, and data products across the company.
 



 You’ll work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other data and analytics stakeholders to create scalable, production-ready pipelines and platforms that drive real business impact — from credit risk and fraud detection to business automation and decision-making.
 



 Together with the rest of the team, you’ll continuously deliver value while improving technical structure and ensuring the reliability and scalability of our systems.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 We believe that you are a systems-oriented engineer who is passionate about enabling machine learning and analytics at scale. You’re curious, analytical, and love turning complex problems into robust technical solutions. You enjoy collaborating across teams, sharing knowledge, and contributing to a data-first culture.
 



  





**Your Experience:** 



* 3 to 5+ years in a similar role, ideally within tech- and product-driven companies
* Designing and building robust data pipelines in production environments
* Working with cloud-based data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake) and streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka)
* Building and maintaining ML-Ops platforms or similar infrastructures
* Working with Python, SQL, and orchestration tools like Airflow or DBT
* Using Docker and Kubernetes, and deploying models via APIs (e.g., FastAPI, KServe)
* Cloud platforms such as Azure or similar
* Feature stores and reusable ML pipelines (strong plus)



  





 As Swedish is our primary working language, we’re looking for someone who’s fluent in both Swedish and English.
 



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 At Froda, you’ll be part of a company that combines the best of both worlds – a fast-moving, high-energy culture with the stability and structure to support long-term success. We’re 100+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, all while having fun together.
 



 Here, you’ll have the opportunity to take ownership of your work, develop your skills, and shape your own growth journey. With big ambitions and a rapidly evolving business, there’s plenty of room to grow, lead initiatives, and make a real impact on both our company and the industry. If you're looking to be part of a success story and contribute to something bigger, this is the place for you.
 



  





**Furthermore, you’ll get:** 



* An opportunity to be part of an exciting journey, shaping the future of our company and transforming the SME financing landscape
* Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
* We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan



  





 If you're excited by our mission of building the tech that powers funding for thousands of entrepreneurs, apply or tell a friend!

title: Backend Engineer - Personalization
description:
On the Personalization Team, we seek to understand the audio world better than anyone else so that we can make great recommendations to every individual person and keep the world listening. Every day, hundreds of millions of people all over the world use the products we build, from Podcast Feeds to Discovery Weekly to DJ. We're a team of technologists, product insight experts, designers, and product managers in Boston, New York, Stockholm, and London.
   

  

 Spotify is looking for a Backend Engineer to join the Search team. Our mission is to help users efficiently find and discover content. We are a highly collaborative team of engineers from multiple disciplines who are passionate about new challenges, product innovation, and building highly scalable distributed systems. We have experience in using new technologies to quickly prototype experiences as well as in building systems that serve content at scale for hundreds of millions of users.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design, develop, and deliver robust and scalable backend systems and APIs.
* Collaborate with other engineers, product owners, and designers to identify and solve challenging problems and build new product features.
* Write clean, maintainable, well-documented code, adhering to coding best practices.
* Participate in the improvement of our software development standards and practices.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging backend technologies and best practices.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have experience writing distributed, high-volume Java services and know how to deploy and keep them running in production.
* You feel comfortable reading and writing Python code.
* You have a good understanding of data structures and algorithms and understand how to apply them to design pragmatic solutions.
* You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and can communicate your ideas to technical and non-technical audiences.
* You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
* You believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
* You have practical experience with Kubernetes.
* You have practical experience managing and operating scalable search engines like ElasticSearch or Vespa.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Lead Python Developer
description:
Equal IT is working with a fast-growing European company on a mission to support entrepreneurs by building smart, user-friendly tools that make running a business easier.
 



  





 Their platform covers everything from invoicing and expense tracking to website creation, helping thousands of self-employed professionals manage their day-to-day more efficiently. The company has also built one of the largest online communities for freelancers offering a space for support, learning, and connection.
 



  





 We are hiring a
 **Lead Python Engineer** 
 to help scale backend systems and shape the technical roadmap for products empowering small business owners.
 



  





**What You Will Do:** 



* Build, Build, Build
* Lead backend architecture and development using
 **Python** 
 and
 **Django**
* Deliver scalable features and third-party integrations
* Mentor engineers and uphold best practices in code quality and security
* Improve development processes and manage technical debt
* Identify and implement innovative backend solutions



  





  





**We Are Looking For:** 



* 5+ years of backend development experience
* Experienced as Senior or Lead, mentoring less-experienced Engineers
* Strong skills in
 **Django** 
 ,
 **PostgreSQL** 
 ,
 **REST APIs** 
 ,
 **Architecture** 
 ,
 **Leadership**
* Experience with
 **Docker** 
 , CI/CD and worked on a major cloud provider
* Strong communication and problem-solving abilities
* Passion for collaborative work and user-focused solutions



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Diverse, supportive, and mission-driven team
* Technical ownership and high-impact projects
* Learning budget and career growth opportunities



  





 🔗 Ready to make an impact? Apply now and help build tools that support the next generation of entrepreneurs.

title: Field Service Engineer
company_industry: Biotechnology Research, Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, and Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
**Overview**
**TA Instruments** 
 is seeking a highly skilled, motivated and customer focused professional to join our world-renowned Field Service Organisation in the Nordics. We would prefer applicants to be based in the
 **Stockholm** 
 area of Sweden to maximise the potential of the region, but will look at applicants from outside this area too. This position covers the majority of Sweden and Norway, so travel will be part of the role.
   

  

 As a Field Service Specialist working for an industry leader, you'll join a global team of engineers that are committed to ensuring TA Instruments' legendary service for our customers utilising our scientific instrumentation and software. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to provide technical expertise on TA Instruments' innovative product suite (
 **Thermal, Rheology, Microcalorimetry** 
 ) for multiple customer laboratories spanning across the Pharmaceutical & Life Sciences, Chemical Materials, Clinical, Food, Battery development, Environmental, Forensics, Academia and Government industries.
   

  

 You will be a motivated self-starter looking after the day to day running of your own territory and scheduling your own workload as neccesary. As the focal point of contact for the region, you must be able to multi-task and have the ability to prioritise work throughout the day.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**So, what do our Field Customer Support Specialists do? Below are some of the key responsibilities:**
* Provide excellent customer service to maintain high level of customer satisfaction
* Repair, install, and maintain all currently supported instrument models and accessories; gains knowledge of applications software; calibrate instruments for optimal performance.
* Prepare a variety of reports, logs and documentation of service and repair activities; prepare service reports for input to the product reliability report; maintain up-to-date calibration data, service notes, drawings, and other materials needed for effectiveness.
* Prepare a variety of paperwork to document work in progress, and other necessary tracking paperwork; submits required paperwork on a timely basis to department management.
* Establishes and maintains prompt professional communications with customers and internal resources.
* Provides information to customers regarding service products and offerings; effectively sells service products and contracts to meet annual regional targets
* Manage your own territory to maximise revenue and efficiency, while keeping the focus on customer satisfaction.


**Qualifications**
**Who are we looking for?**
* 
+ We ask that you are interested in science, problem-solving, service, and people!
+ You could have a laboratory, analytical, chemistry, or engineering background.
+ It’s important that you are flexible and enjoy variety in your role as well as being able to build trusted relationships with our customers.
+ Proven experience with installation, performance maintenance, troubleshooting, support and/or end user utilisation of scientific instrumentation, preference for TA Instruments product suite (Thermal, Rheology, Microcalorimetry)
+ Ability to perform effective system level troubleshooting from service documents and remote support.


 Waters recognizes that there is an under-representation of people from diverse backgrounds within STEM careers and we recognize some groups face marginalization through the job application process. As an inclusive employer, we welcome applications from everyone; you don’t need to meet all the requirements of the role – if you feel you can add value to our business, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Rewards**
 In return, we offer a highly competitive, market-leading benefits package for our employees:
   

  

* Flexibility - We offer a lot of flexibility within your day both with your time and tasks.
* Great Opportunities for growth, development, and progression
* Competitive salary and incentive scheme
* Company Car
* Wellbeing Programs and Services, Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP)
* Social events on the calendar
* Great working environment surrounded by great people


**Company Description**
 Waters Corporation (NYSE:WAT) is a global leader in analytical instruments, separations technologies, and software, serving the life, materials, food, and environmental sciences for over 65 years. Our Company helps ensure the efficacy of medicines, the safety of food and the purity of water, and the quality and sustainability of products used every day. In over 100 countries, our 7,600+ passionate employees collaborate with customers in laboratories, manufacturing sites, and hospitals to accelerate the benefits of pioneering science .
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It benefits our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

title: Bli vår nästa Servicetekniker inom Fastighetsautomation – Siemens, Solna
description:
Låt ditt tekniska intresse bidra till en hållbar värld! Transform the everyday with us
   

  

 Vill du bidra till säkra och energieffektiva lösningar för fastigheter och arbeta i ett team med målsättningen att leverera högkvalitativa produkter och tjänster? Vi på Siemens Smart Infrastructure kombinerar den fysiska och digitala världen för energisystem, byggnader och industrier. I denna roll kommer du att vara baserad på vårt kontor i Solna, med fokus på vår spännande kund vid Nya Karolinska Solna (NKS).
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren tekniker med gedigen bakgrund och expertkunskap inom Fastighetsautomation. Har du den spetskompetens vi söker? Då vill vi att du söker till oss på Siemens!
   

  

 Utmaningen
   

  

 I rollen som tekniker inom fastighetsautomation arbetar du ute hos vår kund med förebyggande underhåll, driftsättning, felsökning, provning och programmering av Siemens system. Dagarna är varierande och du har möjlighet att själv planera ditt arbete. Till din hjälp har du ett väletablerat nätverk av kollegor som ger dig den support och stöttning som du behöver. Som ny hos oss välkomnas du med ett introduktionsprogram av utbildningar, en handledare som ger dig vägledning och trevliga kollegor.
   

  

 Du kommer bli expert på våra system hos vår kund och aktivt ge rådgivning om vad vi kan erbjuda för att utveckla deras anläggningar med nya tekniska lösningar. Du kommer vara en viktig del i vårt team, där du tillsammans med andra tekniker, projektledare, säljare och support utvecklar och underhåller våra kundrelationer.
   

  

 Vem söker vi?
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen är du en person som gillar att ta eget ansvar. Du trivs med kundkontakt och att skapa långsiktiga arbetsrelationer. Du känner ett genuint intresse för att leverera en god service och att hjälpa kunder att utvecklas inom den senaste tekniken. Du har god förmåga att planera och prioritera. Du vill bidra till ett bra arbetsklimat där ni i teamet hjälper och stöttar varandra.
   

  

 Vem är du / Meriterande erfarenheter
   

  

* Du gillar teknik och har gedigen en bakgrund inom fastighetsautomation.
* Du vet hur man programmerar fastighetsautomationssystem och har en god kunskap av integration av de vanligast förekommande systemen.
* Du är intresserad och känner dig bekväm med de IT-relaterade delarna.
* Du har efarenhet av att vara en del projektteam inom byggnadsautomation, gärna inom entreprenaddrivna projekt.
* Körkort och ett svenskt medborgarskap behövs i tjänsten likaså att du kan kommunicera på svenska och engelska.


 Det viktigaste för oss är att du har en bakgrund inom Fastighetsautomation och en stark vilja att lära dig och utvecklas vidare!
   

  

 Vad erbjuder vi?
   

  

 På Siemens gör vi varje dag skillnad för oss själva, våra kunder och vår planet. Vi erbjuder en flexibel arbetsplats med hög grad av frihet och eget ansvar över din arbetsdag. Flexibiliteten ger våra medarbetare möjlighet att skapa en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Tjänstens placeringsort är Solna och självklart finns förmåner såsom friskvårdspaket (5000 kr) och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Välkommen att ansöka idag! Denna rekrytering sker löpandes och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdagen.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Anders Arhelm på e-postadress Anders.Arhelm@siemens.com. För information om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta Rekryterare Ellen Ahlberg på e-postadress ellen.ahlberg@siemens.com. För kontakt med facklig representant mejla facket.se@siemens.com.
   

  

 Då vi arbetar inom säkerhetsbranschen begär vi utdrag från Rikspolisstyrelsens misstanke- och belastningsregister.
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på siemens.se

title: Network Security Engineer
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 We are now looking for an experienced and ambitious Network Security Engineer for our international team who will enjoy a fast- developing international working environment.
   

  

  

  

**What will you do?**
 Your main tasks will consist of operation, development and maintenance of network security infrastructure. As a Network Security Engineer (junior/ medior/senior), you will have a varied job with broad responsibilities in a delivery that takes care of everything from client access networks (LAN / WIFi), distribution networks (WAN/LAN) and data center networks. You will bring your expertise to safeguard Vattenfall network against threat actors using firewall, proxy, IPS, etc. to name a few. You will make a difference by offering security consultancy to provide risk assessment for our customers in new projects.
   

  

 We use several hardware manufacturers in our environments, which contributes to increased opportunities for development and broad expertise
   

  

**Location**
 you can choose to be based in Amsterdam, Berlin or Solna. We do offer hybrid working, but bnot fully remote. We are only considering candidates already living near one of these locations. Additionally, some travelling might be needed for e.g. project or team meeting (in average once a month).
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

 You bring a structured way of working and take your own initiatives to drive your work and development forward. You have the ability and willingness to familiarize yourself with new technology and troubleshooting of varying size and complexity. As a person, you are a elf motivated team player. We encourage innovation, creativity and employees who think outside the box with IT security as a basic principle.  A prerequisite for success is a great drive to want to develop and to learn new things.
   

  

 To succeed in the role, we believe you have at least 3 years of experience in:
   

  

* Webproxy operations
* Network Security (Cisco, FortiGate, SkyHigh, Checkpoint)
* Experience in Intrusion Detection/Prevention systems IDS/IPS
* Firewall Operations
* Network infrastructure operation and monitoring
* WAN, LAN, Routing
* ITIL process frameworks
* Fluent verbal and written proficiency in English (German/Swedish are beneficial)


 Ideally you also bring some of the following:
   

  

* Basic script/programming experience (e.g. Python, Perl)
* Working with Load balancer
* Wireless controllers
* Administrative tooling/Network management systems
* Knowledge about NW products for main market players.


 On-call shifts are part of the work.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

 We offer an exciting and challenging job where you work close to business as well as to technology. You will have the chance to broaden your area of expertise even more and gain a solid understanding of the energy utility business as well. Vattenfall wants to be your employer of choice and offers excellent primary and fringe benefits. Besides being a challenging and inspiring place to work, we value a great work atmosphere. We want to be the best in what we do. We offer good remuneration, attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional growth.
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable efficient and attractive company. Therefore we seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, and ethnic and cultural backgrounds. We believe in work life balance and the flexibility to work from home.
   

  

**For more information** 
 about the position you are welcome to contact IT Recruiter Folmer Koper via folmer1.koper@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We are now taking steps to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: Senior Perception Engineer - Einride Autonomous Technologies
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

**Want to be part of transforming road freight for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through our offering – freight capacity as a service – we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric truck on a public road (Sweden, 2019).
   

  

 In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road.
   

  

 Today, we are a team of more than 300 people, and our award-winning technology is being deployed across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients include some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

 We are looking for a skilled and passionate Senior Perception Engineer specialized in multi-modal perception systems for autonomous driving applications. The ideal candidate has strong software engineering skills and experience in designing, developing and transitioning R&D solutions into final products.
   

  

**In This Role You Will**
* Research and develop state-of-the-art perception algorithms for autonomous vehicles to advance our perception stack
* Implement solutions for multi-modal sensor fusion, 3D object detection, segmentation, tracking in complex dynamic environments, sensor degradation, and other safety-critical systems
* Drive performance improvements
* Integrate, validate, and deploy production-ready solutions
* Collaborate with other members in the Perception organization to continuously improve the perception stack
* Collaborate closely with experts from System Engineering, Localization, Planning, and other teams to build a safe, deployable system


**Qualifications**
* Strong technical background: PhD or highly qualified MS in one of the following: Robotics, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Mathematics, or a related field
* 3-5+ years research or industry experience in one or more of the following: Perception, Sensor Fusion, 2D/3D Computer Vision, Object Tracking, SLAM, Calibration
* Strong foundation in linear algebra, data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis
* Experience in C/C++ and Python, and strong problem-solving skills. You are passionate about solving real-world robotics challenges in the context of autonomous driving**
 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. You will be part of a truly diverse, high performing team with a common passion for sustainability and making things happen in an innovative way. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Partner Sales Manager - IHV Alliances
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Partner Sales Manager to be a key contributing team member within the growing IHV alliances organization. Large OEM or Independent Hardware Vendor (IHV) brands - Dell, HPE, IBM, Lenovo, Ericsson, Cisco, Fujitsu and many more - are major partners for Canonical. These companies build software-defined solutions to capitalize on global open source mandates and associated macro trends. Canonical's flagship product, Ubuntu, and its broader open source portfolio are key ingredients for these partners to realize their aspirations. Canonical represents the best platform for rapid open source innovation.
   

  

 Reporting to the Head of IHV Alliances, the Partner Sales Manager will work closely with IHV and Canonical teams in various geographies to enable IHV teams, generate and transact opportunities, drive a Canonical agenda within an IHV, and achieve targeted results. They are responsible to build trusted relationships with our partners, increase Canonical market share and attach rate, evangelize the partnership and drive business interactions from across persona - from engineer to CxO. They will often run customer workshops focused on particular initiatives at that customer, attend sales events, give public presentations and participate in executive engagements.
   

  

**Location: This is a remote role.**
 The role entails
   

  

* Build strategic relationships and enable partner teams on the partnership
* Build pipeline and transact opportunities through an IHV
* Grow partner awareness of open source capabilities on Canonical Ubuntu
* Demonstrate a deep understanding of the Linux and cloud software ecosystem
* Deliver on targets, objectives and provide a voice of the partner
* Travel regularly - sometimes internationally - to drive partnerships in person
* Align and support internal canonical field teams - identify, support, grow, transact
* Expand existing footprint with IHV customers with an aim to upsell to broader portfolio
* Support and contribute to broader strategy, initiatives and key campaigns


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Experience in alliance or indirect sales management roles
* Autonomous, disciplined, hands-on, get-it-done mentality
* Ability to capture customer requirements, evaluate gaps, identify and create opportunities
* Passionate about Ubuntu products and mission
* Comfortable in fast-paced and high pressure environments with measurable goals
* Experience with Linux, virtualization, containers, and other cloud technologies
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Team player with superior accountability and customer support skills
* Credibility and working knowledge of IHVs - their products, go-to-market motion, and field
* Experience managing cross-functional teams and track record of operational excellence
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events
* Hands on experience with Salesforce and Google Suite a plus


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
**About Filed**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating
 **fast-growing, sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 ⸻
   

  

**Why This Might Be The Worst EA Role Ever**
* This role isn’t for someone looking to color inside the lines.
* You’ll be at the heart of a hypergrowth company where no two days look the same. Priorities shift weekly. Decisions happen in hours, not days. We’re moving fast—sometimes in the wrong direction, more often in the right one.
* If you prefer predictable schedules and well-worn playbooks, this isn’t for you.
* You’ll be supporting multiple senior leaders. You’ll manage chaos into clarity, and make high-leverage decisions that directly impact how quickly we grow.


 ⸻
   

  

**Here’s why it might be the best decision of your early career:**
* You’ll have real impact: You won’t just manage calendars—you’ll unlock time and focus across the company.
* You’ll be trusted with autonomy: You’ll own outcomes, not tasks.
* You’ll grow fast: Just like our business. We review performance every 4 months and reward ownership, not tenure.
* You’ll work globally: You’ll partner with a U.S.-based exec team head over to the nyc office and work to unblock the team there when the CEO is in nyc, and back in Stockholm, when he is in Stockholm.


 ⸻
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Working directly with the CEO daily
* Managing and anticipating the day-to-day needs of senior execs across time zones
* Handling scheduling, travel, logistics, and priorities across teams and geographies
* Keeping internal projects moving through clear communication and operational follow-up
* Building internal systems to scale communication, documentation, and execution
* Acting as the go-to person for unblocking issues, coordinating with stakeholders, and creating leverage across the company
* Managing the office, such as ordering food, stocking and restocking items, handling installations
* Helping to co-ordinate team offsites and travel arrangements


 ⸻
   

  

**You Might Be a Fit If**
* Thrive in ambiguity and make order out of chaos
* Communicate crisply and confidently across cultures and hierarchies
* Anticipate needs before they’re spoken
* Stay calm and organized in high-pressure situations
* Take pride in being the person others rely on to get things done
* Are fluent in English (Swedish is a bonus, not a requirement)
* Are comfortable working with AI tools, digital workflows, and fast-changing priorities


 ⸻
   

  

**What We Offer**
* We operate with radical transparency—around pay, goals, and performance
* We favor action over perfection, ownership over process
* We obsess over outcomes—not activity
* We believe titles don’t matter, but results do


 ⸻
   

  

**The Process**
* A quick intro call
* One in-person working session with the team
* Then we decide together if it’s the right fit


 ⸻
   

  

 Let’s go.

title: Sr ML Engineer - skapa insiktsdrivna lösningar!
description:
**Elvenite är Nordens ledande Infor M3 CloudSuite-partner och specialister på att skapa affärsvärde genom datadrivna insikter på marknadsledande plattformar.**


Vi söker efter fler erfarna ML kollegor som vill hjälpa till att bygga säkra och flexibla lösningar för våra kunder och för framtidens utmaningar.

**Om rollen**


Vi söker en erfaren och innovativ Senior ML Engineer som vill leda utvecklingen av avancerade datadrivna lösningar. I denna roll kommer du att ha en nyckelposition i våra kundteam och skapa insiktsdrivna lösningar. Du kommer att arbeta som lösningsarkitekt och med komplexa affärsproblem, avancerad analys och implementation av ML modeller i syfte att skapa "business exellence" med hjälpa av data. Du blir viktig internt och ditt arbete kommer att vara kontinuerlig utveckling av affärserbjudandet och våra tjänster framåt.

**Ansvarsområden**


Du blir en arkitekt och nyckelperson i AI projektens alla steg och är med i hela resan från PRE-sale till förvaltning. Du kommer få implementera end-to-end ML system, det innebär att vara med från problemställning, prototyping, implementation, produktionssätta modeller och förvaltning. Du får tidigt sätta dig in i våra kunders verksamheter och identifiera behov och möjligheter till effektivisering genom att utvärdera AI mognadsgrad i kunders data. Nästa steg blir att identifiera och utvärdera ML modeller, applicera MLOps och DevOps för varje verksamhet och säkerställa att det finns skalbarhet, prestanda och kvalité i våra lösningar. Ansvaret innebär också att leda tekniska projekt, fatta beslut och leverera i tid, då krävs det ett gott samarbete mellan olika avdelningar och nära dialog med Data Engineers, Software Engineers, Data Scientists och stakeholders.


Långsiktiga lösningar och värdeskapande är något vi lever för och i en föränderlig värld behöver vi vara uppdaterade på de senaste metoderna och lösningarna, så ditt jobb blir även att ha koll på nya genombrott och trender för att utveckla affärsområdet och våra tjänster framåt. Elvenite är ett bolag som växer och du får även en viktig roll internt som mentor för juniora kollegor och du får vara med och bidra till kunskapsutbyte och bygga teamwork mellan olika avdelningar och projektteamet.


**Kunskaper som krävs för denna roll:**

* Minst 7 års erfarenhet av liknande roll
* Trygg med AWS och/eller Microsoft Azure/fabric
* Levererar modeller från prototyping till genomförd produktion
* Talar språket för både algoritmer och affärs-KPI:er
* Ligger steget före i AI/ML-genombrott och förutser risker innan de sker
* Är skicklig i Python och ML-ramverk som TensorFlow eller Torch.
* Leder tekniska projekt och fattar strategiska beslut
* Intresserad av att analysera och lösa komplexa dataproblem.
* Kommunicerar enkelt med stakeholders som projektmedlemmar
* Är affärsmässig och har gärna konsulterfarenhet


Det är ett plus om du har följande kunskaper (ej ett måste):

* Implementering av CI/CD-pipelines och infrastruktur-som-kod för robusta och repeterbara implementeringar
* Funktionslager och pipelines för realtidsinferens
* Delta Lake eller Iceberg
* Infor Cloud Suite


Vi söker seniora maskininlärningsingenjörer med olika färdigheter och en passion för att lösa komplexa problem och med affärsmässig påverkan.

**Jobba på Elvenite**


Vi är ett jämställt gäng i olika åldrar och med varierande erfarenheter och kompetenser som trivs ihop och utvecklas framåt. Långsiktighet och att göra saker tillsammans är kärnan i allt vi gör – från vår företagskultur och våra värderingar, till våra kundrelationer och projekt. Genom nära dialog, ömsesidigt förtroende och en stor dos nyfikenhet fokuserar vi inte bara på att lösa dagens utmaningar, utan på att bygga hållbara relationer som kontinuerligt skapar värde i en snabbt föränderlig digital värld. År 2023 blev vi utsedda till Sveriges bästa arbetsplats och vi hamnade på Europas nionde plats! Tycker du att det är viktigt att ha ett bra team omkring dig och en kultur där du ständigt utvecklas och jobbar mot gemensamma mål? Om ditt svar är ja, då kommer du trivas hos oss.


**Om Elvenite**


På Elvenite pratar vi inte bara om digitaliseringens möjligheter – vi är ”doers” som varje dag omvandlar potentialen i data och modern teknologi till smarta lösningar som låser upp nya insikter, optimerar processer och banar väg för ökad effektivitet, innovation och hållbar tillväxt.


Sedan starten 2007 har vi växt till ett företag med 180 medarbetare som jobbar på något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping, Karlstad, Helsingfors och Rumänien. 2018 blev vi en del av CombinedX och den 1 januari 2025 gick vi samman med M3CS och bildade Nordens ledande Infor M3-partner med tillhörande Data Intelligence och AI.

**Processen**

* Start - 1 Sept eller enligt överenskommelse
* Lön - individuell lönesättning
* Några av våra förmåner:
* + 5000kr i friskvårdsbidrag
	+ Kompetensutveckling
	+ Vi erbjuder flera aktiviteter under året inom trivsel, hälsa och hållbarhet.
* Arbetstid - heltid, 100%
* Ort - vi ser gärna att du bor i närheten av något kontor då vi trivs att arbeta på kontoret, men det går självklart bra att arbeta hemifrån när du känner för det.
* Sista ansökningsdag – 27 Juni

title: Information Security
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Develop and implement comprehensive security strategies that align with the organization's goals.
* Develop governing documents within our ISMS according to ISO27001 and NIST frameworks
* Responsible for several operational tasks in the security management processes and procedures
* Understands business directions/objectives and market conditions to assess information security risks and opportunities
* Drive security initiatives end to end
* Identify, assess, and mitigate security risks across the organization.
* Oversee the operations of the SOC service and ensure ability of incident response.
* Coordinate with other security & privacy functions as well as independently manage diverse information security development tasks
* Secure the overall security posture for the organization both in operations and development
* Provide awareness and trainings to the organization in the area of security

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Solid experience working in the field of information security, minimum 7-10+ years
* In depth knowledge in the frameworks ISO27001/2, NIST, NIS2, SOX
* In depth knowledge of cybersecurity principles, technologies and best practices
* In depth knowledge from risk assessment & management
* Documented experience from audit related work
* Documented experience working with business continuity and DRP planning
* Able to show certifications or documented work experience equivalent (e.g CISSP, CISM, CEH, and CISA.)

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 13-06-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Test Engineer

title: Ingenjör inom testautomation
description:
*Vill du ta testautomatisering till nästa nivå tillsammans med oss på Nexer Engineering?*  

  

*Vi växer inom försvarssegmentet i Stockholm och söker en erfaren testautomatiserare som vill vara med och forma framtidens teknik. Hos oss får du chansen att utvecklas i en innovativ miljö och skapa lösningar som gör verklig skillnad!*

**Om Nexer Engineering**


Vi samarbetar med branschledande företag och är specialiserade på produktutveckling, CI/CD och test. Just nu gör vi en satsning där vi riktar fokus på långsiktiga uppdrag inom försvarsindustrin, där vi täcker kompetensområdena inom allt från mjukvaruutveckling till CI/CD och testautomation.


Hos oss får du stora möjligheter att utvecklas inom testautomation och jobba i teknikens framkant där du utvecklas och lär dig nya saker hela tiden. När du känner att det är dags för en ny utmaning så finns det goda möjligheter att växa vidare genom Nexer - kanske blir du nyfiken på uppdrag hos någon av våra andra produktutvecklande kunder eller att kliva in i en annan roll på sikt? Vi ser inga begränsningar!

**Om rollen**


Som konsult hos Nexer Engineering kommer du att driva och utveckla testautomatisering i ett av våra uppdrag i Stockholmsområdet. I rollen kan du arbeta strategiskt såväl som operativt, genom att exempelvis koda tester och hjälpa våra kunder sätta riktning för hur de kan arbeta med testautomatisering framåt.


Det kan till exempel handla om att:  

  



* Utveckla, implementera och underhålla testramverk
* Integrera tester i CI/CD-pipelinen tillsammans med utvecklings- och DevOps-team
* Integrera med HIL-riggar
* Vara ett stöd till teamen i testautomatiseringsverktyg och arbetssätt
* Identifiera förbättringar och driva förändring

**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig som har minst åtta års erfarenhet inom utveckling/test och ett driv att utveckla både verktyg, metoder och människor. Du är analytisk, strukturerad och gillar att samarbeta. Framför allt brinner du för att höja kvaliteten genom smart automation!


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:

* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering
* Utvecklarbakgrund inom hårdvara/mjukvara
* Goda kunskaper i C/C++, Python
* Erfarenhet av olika testramverk, till exempel Jenkins eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och HIL
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska såväl i tal som skrift
  

**Ansökan**


Låter detta som en utmaning för dig? Då är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi har tyvärr ingen möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via mail, men du som har frågor är välkommen att kontakta Victoria Olsson: victoria.olsson@nexergroup.com

title: Senior Test Engineer - Helsingborg
description:
**Senior Test Engineer – Infrastructure & Automation**


We are looking for a driven and highly skilled Senior Test Engineer to support a customer project focused on IT infrastructure. The ideal candidate brings extensive experience in automated testing, combined with a solid understanding of on-premise cloud environments and Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) solutions.

**Location:** Helsingborg  

**Start date:** To be agreed  

**Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis**

### **Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, implement, and execute automated test cases for advanced infrastructure environments
* Work closely with development and infrastructure teams to ensure solutions are testable and meet quality standards
* Analyze results, troubleshoot defects, and drive issues to resolution
* Contribute to the development and improvement of test automation frameworks and processes
* Stay up to date with current trends and best practices in infrastructure testing and automation

### **Required Skills and Experience:**

* Proven expertise in automated testing tools and methodologies
* Strong knowledge of IT infrastructure components including compute, storage, networking, and virtualization
* Hands-on experience with OpenStack and its core services (Compute, Storage, Networking, Shared Services, Orchestration)
* Solid background in testing infrastructure and IaaS solutions
* Skilled in creating and maintaining comprehensive test plans and test documentation
* Analytical mindset and excellent problem-solving skills
* Strong communication and teamwork abilities

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
* Experience testing high-availability and disaster recovery configurations
* Certifications related to test automation or cloud infrastructure are a plus

 **About** **Rasulson Consulting**  

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Devops-konsult till plattformsteam
description:
**Start****17-08-2025****Duration****> 12 months**
  
**Uppdragsbeskrivning**


emagine söker efter en konsult med stor erfarenhet inom plattform till ett team på DIGG.


Vill du jobba i ett plattformsteam där ni tillsammans skapar en grundstruktur för utveckling, drift och förvaltning av


Diggs IT-tjänster?


Digg ansvarar för infrastruktur och tjänster som ska användas av många olika offentliga aktörer.


Nu förstärker vi inom IT-avdelningen och söker en konsult till vårt Plattformsteam.


Vår tekniska målmiljö är ett antal kubernetes-kluster från Red Hat (Openshift 4) där vi idag driftar egna tjänster,


utvecklingsmiljöer och vår CI/CD-pipelines. Vi utvecklar mikrotjänster i Java och Quarkus samt använder Vue för


frontendutveckling med typescript. Om du har erfarenheter av större datacenter och Linux-serverdrift är det enbart


positivt då vi har ett eget datacenter.


I vårt plattformsteam kommer du tillsammans med dina teamkollegor bl.a. konfigurera för deployment av


applikationer och andra funktioner som loggning och övervakning av driftsatta applikationer.

**Konsulten ska ha:**


a) Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Linux som utvecklings- och driftmiljö


b) Minst 5 års erfarenhet av versionshantering i Git eller motsvarande


c) Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Docker eller Podman


d) Minst 2 års erfarenhet av GitOps


e) Minst 2 års erfarenhet av konfiguration av applikationer för deployment i Kubernetes/Openshift


f) Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete i agila team


g) Skriva och tala svenska flytande

**Konsulten bör ha:**


h) Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Kustomize / Helm


i) Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Istio / Service Mesh


j) Minst 1 års erfarenhet av administration av GitLab


k) Minst 1 års erfarenhet av PKI-hantering


l) Minst 1 års erfarenhet av administration av Nexus


m) Minst 1 års erfarenhet av administration av PostgreSQL


n) Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Terraform


Tid: 2025-08-18 till och med 2026-08-17


Språk: Svenska


Plats: Stockholm eller Sundsvall (1 dag per vecka onsite)


För att vara aktuell för rollen så ska man uppfylla samtliga skall-krav samt de flesta bör-kraven. Redovisa gärna hur många bör-krav ni uppfyller.


Svara med CV+önskat pris. Priset kommer spela stor roll i utvärderingen.

title: Expert Sales med fokus på Red Hat/IBM
description:
Är du en lagspelare som vill bli en del av landslaget? Våra kunders investeringar i mjukvara och molntjänster är verksamhetskritiska och kräver därför service, rådgivning och support i världsklass. Just nu söker vi på Expert Sales inom Software Cloud and Services (SCS) dig som vill jobba som Expert Sales med fokus på Red Hat / IBM. Vi är 20 säljare som arbetar med våra fokustillverkare i vårt team inom SCS som nu behöver förstärkas.


**Din roll**
------------



Som Expert Sales tillhör du vårt team vars uppdrag är att utveckla vår affär med Red Hat / IBM. Du upprättar en affärsplan samt exekverar och följer upp våra KPI:er, Du agerar expertstöd för SW specialistsäljare, Specialistsäljare inom övriga affärsområden, Software Center och vårt SMB-team. Samt att integrera med våra konsultgrupperingar.


Arbetet består av många delar, vilket gör det både komplext, roligt och utmanande. Du kommer utmana och vägleda våra kunder och våra specialister till nya lösningar och tjänster som hjälper våra kunder på sin digitala resa och du kommer hantera prissättning, kostnadskalkylering, juridiska frågor och upphandlingar. Du behöver trivas i en rådgivande roll och drivas av att göra affärer. Jag tror dessutom att du behöver vara lyhörd och ha stor social förmåga.



Du kommer driva affärer själv men framförallt jobbar du tillsammans med specialisten alt. AM/KAM med den enskilda affären. Det finns stora strategiska inslag samt förväntningar om att ta fram nya tjänster/erbjudanden. Utbildning och informationsspridning är också en viktig del av arbetet. Vårt fokus är software men vår leverans kan bestå av hård- och mjukvara, service, konsulting och molntjänster.


Du kommer arbeta proaktivt för att alltid säkerställa den bästa lösningen för kunden över tid och det sker i nära samarbete med tillverkaren, våra lösningsarkitekter och konsulter. Du kommer inte ansvara för enskilda kunder dvs ha kundlead men det ingår också i uppdraget att bearbeta kunder. Du kommer arbeta med anbud, upphandlingar samt med avtal, prissättning, förhandling och bära en individuell budget. Du kommer äga ansvaret för totala software budgeten för tillverkaren.



Du erbjuds en utvecklande roll där varje dag erbjuder nya intressanta utmaningar att hantera tillsammans med dina kollegor, våra leverantörer och våra kunder.


**Vem är du?**
--------------


**För att lyckas i tjänsten som specialistsäljare**



Du trivs i rollen som ”Trusted Advisor” och har därför en stor drivkraft att hela tiden lära dig nya saker för att kunna ha ett proaktivt förhållningssätt och söker lösningar i uppkomna problem där du fungerar konstruktivt både på egen hand och i grupp. Du är driven och självständig i ditt arbete, noggrann och beredd att gräva djupt för att möta kundernas behov och krav. Professionalism kännetecknar dig i allt du gör. Du är bra på att skapa relationer och ger ett förtroendeingivande intryck. Utöver det så har du förmågan att driva en process framåt och leda virtuella team för att klara en uppgift inom utsatt tid. Du har lätt att kommunicera i tal och skrift, både när det gäller svenska och engelska samt att du är van att göra presentationer och har förmågan att på ett enkelt sätt förklara erbjudandet och nyttan både ur ett affärsmässigt och ett tekniskt perspektiv.



För att lyckas i tjänsten som Expert Sales Red Hat / IBM tror vi att du har följande:


* Lång erfarenhet av försäljning
* Bekväm att utmana i dialoger tex kring DevOps och Containerteknologi
* God kännedom om Red Hats produktportfölj
* Du klassificerar dig själv mellan specialistsälj och lösningsarkitekt

**Om Atea**
-----------



Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.



På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.


**Kontakt & mer information**
-----------------------------



Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Johan Bivstedt, Försäljningschef, via johan.bivstedt@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!



Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare. SUA-text vid säkerhetsklassade uppdrag: [En anställning hos oss kan även innebära placering i säkerhetsklassat uppdrag. Därmed kan en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll komma att genomföras både före och under anställning.]



Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

  


**Följ oss i sociala medier**

  

#LI-REMOTE

Sverige

title: Senior Accountant
description:
**Ready to elevate your accounting career in a dynamic environment? Join Eficode’s finance team as a Senior Accountant and be instrumental in driving our accounting excellence. We offer a supportive and growth-oriented culture where your expertise is valued. Take the leap and shape your future with us.**

**Welcome to Eficode!**


We are building the future of software development - specialising in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organisations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, emphasis on mental wellbeing, and a supportive, autonomous team culture.


We're seeking a **Senior Accountant** to contribute significantly to the financial health and ultimately support the strategic decision-making of our organization in Sweden. You will be a vital part of the Finance team for the Scandinavia region, covering Sweden, Denmark, and Norway, and will report directly to the Head of Finance for the region.

 **Why join us?**

  

* Be part of a leading DevOps and Cloud consulting company with over 650 experts across 10 countries.
* Grow your career in a learning driven culture with opportunities for training, certifications, and knowledge sharing.
* With 130 colleagues in Sweden, we have offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö and Sundsvall. Our flexible and open work culture, focus on continuous learning, and industry leading expertise make us a great place to grow your career.


We offer you:

* A flexible work model that supports a healthy work-life balance.
* A team of driven and experienced colleagues who support and challenge each other.
* A company where your expertise makes a difference – influence solutions and drive innovation.
* Flexible work & strong benefits: enjoy comprehensive benefits including a pension program, health insurance, and wellness allowance.
* To find out more about life at Eficode, and hear what our people think about us, click here.
* 
* 

**Ready to take on a new challenge?**

* **Comprehensive financial record management:** Oversee all bookkeeping activities, ensuring accurate and up-to-date maintenance of financial records, including the general ledger and subsidiary ledgers, adhering to established accounting principles.
* **Period-end close & reporting:** Independently drive efficient month-end and year-end close processes. This includes performing critical account reconciliations, preparing adjusting entries, and generating timely, accurate financial statements and supporting reports for management.
* **Compliance & audit:** Prepare necessary documentation and actively support internal and external financial audits, ensuring regulatory compliance and responding to auditor inquiries.
* **Financial analysis & integrity:** Conduct detailed account reconciliations (e.g., bank, intercompany, balance sheet accounts) to identify discrepancies and maintain the integrity of financial data, contributing to reliable financial reporting.
* **Process optimization & controls:** Identify opportunities to enhance accounting processes, systems, and internal controls to improve efficiency, accuracy, and data security within the financial function.
* **Supporting strategic financial initiatives:** Assist in various financial reporting, analysis, and ad-hoc projects, providing reliable financial insights that support overall business objectives.

**Success factors**

* Minimum 8 years of similar experience, preferably from the software industry and/or IT consulting services.
* Accounting experience in accordance with laws and regulations in Sweden (K3).
* Solid experience of financial statements, accustomed to reconciliations of balance sheets and income statements as well as intercompany transactions.
* Demonstrated experience in independently preparing and submitting annual reports, corporate income tax returns, and other statutory reporting to Swedish authorities (e.g., Skatteverket).
* Strong command in spreadsheets (MS Excel, Google Sheets) and financial software.
* Full professional proficiency in English and in Swedish.
* B. Sc. or M. Sc. in accounting or related field.

**Desired skills and qualifications**


It would be an added bonus if you have:

  

* Familiarity with accounting regulations in Denmark and/or Norway.
* Experience in Netsuite.
* Prior experience in SaaS or IT consulting sector.
  

**About you**


This is a great opportunity for someone who:

  

* Highly accurate and detail-oriented, with a driven approach and the ability to provide expert knowledge.
* Proactive and initiative-taking, responsible and reliable, contributing with improvement proposals.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and stakeholders.
  

**Apply today!**


This role is full-time and is available in **Stockholm**. The position will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate is found, adjusted to the candidate’s availability, and we will start interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis as we receive the applications.


Join us and contribute to our success and growth. We look forward to reviewing your application!  

  

*At Eficode, we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants.*

*We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognize that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds and cultures we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*

*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information and your picture on your job application.*

*Eficode, better made possible.*

title: IDMC Administrator
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.


At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for an Informatica Data Management Cloud Administrator to join our team in Sweden.


**About the team**

Cognizant collaborates with all major hyperscale’s and relevant software vendors in the data and AI space. This includes partnerships with industry leaders such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Snowflake, and Databricks. Our comprehensive approach ensures that we leverage the best tools and technologies to deliver scalable, secure, and efficient solutions. Additionally, we are supported locally by our dedicated Centres of Excellence, which operate both nearshore and offshore. These centres provide specialized expertise and resources, ensuring that we can meet the unique needs of our clients and drive innovation in AI and data cost effectively.


**About the role**

An IDMC (Informatica Data Management Cloud) Administrator manages and maintains an Informatica IDMC environment, ensuring high availability, performance, and security. This role requires expertise in IDMC platform administration, data integration, and data governance processes, along with the ability to provide technical support and troubleshoot issues. The position is crucial for ensuring the smooth operation of the Informatica platform and providing strategic solutions for future growth.


**Key responsibilities**


* Configure and maintain connections to cloud and on-premises data sources and targets.
* Deploy and schedule data integration jobs, workflows, and task flows.
* Troubleshoot job failures, performance issues, and integration errors.
* Implement and enforce data security policies, including encryption, masking, and access control.
* Maintain metadata and data lineage using Informatica Cloud Data Governance and Catalog (CDGC).
* Support version control and deployment processes using CI/CD tools (e.g., Git, Azure DevOps).
* Automate administrative tasks using scripts or built-in IDMC automation features.
* Collaborate with data engineers and architects to support integration and data quality initiatives.

**Requirements**


* Proficiency in Informatica IDMC platform components:
* + Cloud Data Integration (CDI)
	+ Cloud Application Integration (CAI)
	+ Informatica Data Quality (IDQ)
	+ Cloud Data Governance and Catalog (CDGC)
* Skills in scheduling, monitoring, and troubleshooting data integration jobs and taskflows.
* Knowledge of data security practices: encryption, masking, and access control.
* Experience with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud.
* Understanding of API integration and web services (REST/SOAP).
* Ability to use monitoring tools and generate audit and usage reports.

**What you can expect**


* Become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth!
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* Drive your own career
* Market conforms benefits

For more information contact: Cajsa.orvenholt@cognizant.com

title: Senior Test Engineer
description:
Senior Test Engineer – Infrastructure & Automation
  
We are looking for a driven and highly skilled Senior Test Engineer to support a customer project focused on IT infrastructure. The ideal candidate brings extensive experience in automated testing, combined with a solid understanding of on-premise cloud environments and Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) solutions.
  
**Location:** Helsingborg
  
**Start date:** To be agreed
  
Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design, implement, and execute automated test cases for advanced infrastructure environments
  
Work closely with development and infrastructure teams to ensure solutions are testable and meet quality standards
  
Analyze results, troubleshoot defects, and drive issues to resolution
  
Contribute to the development and improvement of test automation frameworks and processes
  
Stay up to date with current trends and best practices in infrastructure testing and automation
  
  

**Required Skills and Experience:**  

Proven expertise in automated testing tools and methodologies
  
Strong knowledge of IT infrastructure components including compute, storage, networking, and virtualization
  
Hands-on experience with OpenStack and its core services (Compute, Storage, Networking, Shared Services, Orchestration)
  
Solid background in testing infrastructure and IaaS solutions
  
Skilled in creating and maintaining comprehensive test plans and test documentation
  
Analytical mindset and excellent problem-solving skills
  
Strong communication and teamwork abilities
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
  
Experience testing high-availability and disaster recovery configurations
  
Certifications related to test automation or cloud infrastructure are a plus
  
  

About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Talent acquisition specialist
description:
Vi letar efter dig som är en erfaren rekryterare med ett skarpt öga för utvecklare och andra vassa techprofiler. Du vet – de där rollerna som kräver både tålamod, nyfikenhet och kreativitet att hitta. Känner du igen dig? Då kan du vara vår nästa kollega!
  
Om oss Knowit är ett nordiskt konsultbolag där tech möter människa – och vi i Talent Acquisition-teamet är med och bygger framtidens digitala stjärnteam. På Stockholmskontoret får du sällskap av två TA-kollegor (eminenta Kalle & Jesper) och en handfull härliga rekryterare runt om i landet som gärna bollar case, knep och verktyg. Tillsammans utgör vi den svenska TA-organisationen för Knowits största affärsområde.
  
Vad kommer du att göra? Hos oss kommer du att få ta ett helhetsgrepp om rekryteringsprocessen. Du kommer framförallt att jobba med att rekrytera utvecklare och andra komplexa techroller, där search ofta är en naturlig del av processen.
  
Du kommer vara ett nära bollplank till våra chefer, där du växlar mellan rådgivare, kravställare och strategiskt stöd. En viktig del av rollen handlar också om att bidra till vårt employer branding-arbete – kanske har du egna idéer för kampanjer, innehåll eller events som får oss att sticka ut i mängden? Vi gillar struktur och jobbar datadrivet, så vi hoppas att du också tycker om att ha koll på processer, system och KPI: er som hjälper oss bli ännu bättre.
  
Vi vet – det pratas om AI överallt just nu. Men vi hoppas att du inte har tröttnat, utan tvärtom känner dig nyfiken och taggad på allt som händer. För AI förändrar spelplanen, och det snabbt. Vi är säkra på att vi snart kommer att rekrytera roller vi idag ännu inte ens vet att vi behöver. Om du går igång på tanken att hitta framtidens AI-pionjärer, då kommer du att trivas hos oss.
  
  

**Vi tror att du har:**  

3–5 års erfarenhet av rekrytering inom tech – gärna av utvecklare, arkitekter, DevOps och andra roller som kräver mer än ett LinkedIn-sök.
  
Gedigen erfarenhet av search och vana att nå kandidater bortom de mest uppenbara nätverken
  
Intresse för (eller erfarenhet av) employer branding – stort plus om du gillar att skapa innehåll eller driva initiativ
  
  

Till den här rollen behöver du behärska svenska och engelska flytande i både tal och skrift.
  
Vi tror att du är en person med en blandning av prestigelöshet och professionalism. Du gillar att bygga relationer – både med kandidater, chefer och kollegor – och tar dig gärna tid för en kaffe med någon du inte jobbat med tidigare. Du trivs bäst när det händer saker runt dig, och tycker att det är kul att vara på kontoret och bidra till energin i teamet.
  
Vad får du hos oss? Hos oss får du frihet under ansvar och stor tillit till din kompetens – vi tror att du gör ditt bästa när du får utrymme att påverka hur jobbet ska göras. Du får kollegor som gärna delar med sig av kunskap, skrattar ofta och aldrig tackar nej till en kaffe eller ett spontant samtal. Vi är ett team där idéer tas på allvar, och där du har möjlighet att vara med och forma både våra arbetssätt och vår kultur. Dessutom är Knowit ett bolag som faktiskt bryr sig – om hållbarhet, om inkludering och om att vi alla ska kunna utvecklas i en riktning som känns meningsfull.
  
Ansökan Vi använder analyser i rekryteringsprocessen för att säkerställa en rättvis bedömning av dig som kandidat och ha ett kompetensbaserat urval. Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten redan idag!
  
Har du frågor om tjänsten? Välkommen att kontakta Elin (tillika närmsta chef) på elin.zahlander@knowit.se eller 073-656 35 75.
